intro: Rubus rubriflorus, commonly known as the red-flowered bramble, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves, typical of many bramble species. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits known as drupes, which are usually red or black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. The flowers are typically white or pink, with five petals and numerous stamens.
